A married teacher who had sex with an underage pupil at her home and in a park has been jailed for just a year . 
Brandi Lynn Vaughn admitted one charge of using an electronic device to induce a minor to engage in sexual activities. 
The Class D felony is punishable by one to five years in prison. Vaughn will be eligible for parole after serving 20 percent of her term. 
The 25-year-old's legal team was able to negotiate a plea deal in Berea, Kentucky. 
Backing the plea agreement, Judge William Clouse agreed six other Class D felony charges against Vaughn be dismissed. Read More 
These were two counts of first-degree sexual abuse; two counts of third-degree sodomy; one count of third-degree rape and one count of evidence tampering. 
Vaughn, who taught science at Madison Southern High School , was arrested in August 2015. Vaughn was a science teacher at Madison Southern High School (Photo: Chris Murphy) 
The Richmond Register reports the teacher confessed to investigators to having sex with the then-16-year-old male student twice, according to the Berea Police Department. 
One incident took place at a state park, while the other took place at the then-married teacher’s home.
